intro: Stenostephanus madrensis, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and chrysanthemums. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
